title: Girl left looking like 'alien' after bath bomb stains her and bathroom green
text:

Spending an afternoon with your child and a make-your-own-bath-bomb kit during the school holidays sounds like harmless fun.

Kerri Sackville found out the hard way that it's not always the case after being left facing a sight reminiscent of Shrek's swamp a few hours later.

The Australian mum had been shopping in one of her favourite stores, Kmart, with her 11-year-old daughter and picked up a couple of pairs of leggings and some batteries.

The pair then stumbled across a unicorn bath bomb kit for around £8, suitable for children eight and over, and decided it would be 'perfect holiday fun', wrote Kerri on News.com.au .

Returning home, they set about putting together their creation which took an hour - 20 minutes to make the bath bomb and 40 minutes to clean up the mess left behind. It was a stark warning of things to come.

The table was green, the floor was green, her daughter's hands and hair were green.

But the hard work was done and her daughter ran a bath and dropped in their homemade addition.

Not long after, Kerri received a call of 'mum, come here!' from the bathroom.

"I trudged to the bathroom, swung open the door, and nearly choked on my own tongue," she says. "What I saw was horrifying.

"My daughter stood in the bath, arms above her head, laughing hysterically. My precious child was emerald green.

“Look, mum! I’m an alien!”

Not only was her child green, but so too was the bath water, the bath and much of wall.

Kerri describes it as 'not just a splash of colour' but as though the Incredible Hulk had laid down in their bath and 'melted'.

The mum says she eventually got bathroom clean, although glints of emerald remain in the grouting.

Kmart said it wasn't aware of any issues with the make-your-own-bath-bomb kit but encouraged any other customers who have experienced similar problems to get in touch.

A spokesperson said: “At Kmart Australia we are committed to the quality and safety of all of our products. We have not received an inquiry of this nature, but we welcome the opportunity to resolve this directly with the customer."

Have you ever had a disaster with a beauty product? Email yourmirror@trinitymirror.com to let us know your story.
description: Mum Kerri bought the bath bomb kit for 'holiday fun' but it quickly went downhill
